title: Rays finalizing deal with versatile Keppinger
subtitle: Rays finalizing deal with versatile Keppinger
body: The Rays and infielder Jeff Keppinger agreed to a one-year deal on Wednesday, pending a physical, a source confirmed on Thursday. Financial terms of the agreement were not available. Keppinger, who will turn 32 in April, has played seven seasons in the Majors with the Mets, Royals, Reds, Astros and Giants. He hit .277 and posted a .300 on-base percentage in 99 games last season while playing for the Astros and Giants. Keppinger, who has played second base, shortstop and third base in his career, is a .281 career hitter.  Cash Kruth is a reporter for MLB.com. Follow him on Twitter at @cashkruth. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Cash Kruth
